review: It really is a great piece and one that is great to have at such a cheap price.However, you are limited to very very very few apps that will run on it as of 3/5/14.  That is the most disappointing.  Then there is the "chrome tab to cast" issue that drives me up the wall.  My laptop IN MY OFFICE can share a tab to the cast IN MY LIVING ROOM but my tablet that is sitting on my coffee table in the LR CAN'T...............  that is the most ridiculous thing there is!!  I'm hoping one day all this becomes a reality and i can share my chrome tab from tablet to cast and that every app is able to be put on the cast.  How great would it be to play Angry birds on your tv right?  make it a family night out of it!!  Even send my email up to the big screen! And with FB having videos posted that are not youtube, you can't share them with others in the room on the TV....So, its nice to have but it has a long way to go before it's 5 stars in my book.

review: We cancelled cable and got a Chromecast.  Most of what's on TV is garbage now anyways and netflix will keep us plenty busy on the long cold nights.  It was a good decision.One of the best features: when the Chromecast isn't playing anything you see a series of beautiful landscapes or other pictures displayed with a nice little clock in the corner.  35$ is worth it for that alone.  For those of you that like your little cable box clock, this is better.  We leave our TV on all the time now so we can see the nice pictures.They say you can cast chrome tabs on the chromecast: I don't care.  We don't use that.  We use this purely as a netflix portal with a tablet and it is the best netflix experience I have yet to find.  No more slow bluray interface.  I'm not buying an Xbox or a PS4 for netflix.  35$ chromecast is perfect.  Sometimes I nerd out and use it to watch League of Legends games on youtube and pick my nose and that's nice.It's 35$.  Stop being a cheapass scaredycat and buy it.
